refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A GstUri object can be used to parse and split a URI string into its constituant parts. Two GstUri objects can be joined to make a new GstUri using the algorithm described in RFC3986.

refsect2.title: gst_uri_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstUri object with the given URI parts. The path and query strings will be broken down into their elements. All strings should not be escaped except where indicated.

entry.para: The scheme for the new URI.
The user-info for the new URI.
The host name for the new URI.
The port number for the new URI or GST_URI_NO_PORT.
The path for the new URI with '/' separating path elements.
The query string for the new URI with '&' separating query elements. Elements containing '&' characters should encode them as "%26".
The fragment name for the new URI.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A new GstUri object.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_new_with_base ()
refsect2.para: Like gst_uri_new(), but joins the new URI onto a base URI.

entry.para: The base URI to join the new URI to.
The scheme for the new URI.
The user-info for the new URI.
The host name for the new URI.
The port number for the new URI or GST_URI_NO_PORT.
The path for the new URI with '/' separating path elements.
The query string for the new URI with '&' separating query elements. Elements containing '&' characters should encode them as "%26".
The fragment name for the new URI.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The new URI joined onto base .

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_from_string ()
refsect2.para: Parses a URI string into a new GstUri object. Will return NULL if the URI cannot be parsed.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A new GstUri object, or NULL.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_from_string_with_base ()
refsect2.para: Like gst_uri_from_string() but also joins with a base URI.

entry.para: The base URI to join the new URI with.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A new GstUri object.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_copy ()
refsect2.para: Create a new GstUri object with the same data as this GstUri object. If uri is NULL then returns NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A new GstUri object which is a copy of this GstUri or NULL.

refsect2.title: gst_uri_equal ()
refsect2.para: Compares two GstUri objects to see if they represent the same normalized URI.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the normalized versions of the two URI's would be equal.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_join ()
refsect2.para: Join a reference URI onto a base URI using the method from RFC 3986. If either URI is NULL then the other URI will be returned with the ref count increased.

entry.para: The base URI to join another to.
The reference URI to join onto the base URI.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A GstUri which represents the base with the reference URI joined on.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_join_strings ()
refsect2.para: This is a convenience function to join two URI strings and return the result. The returned string should be g_free()'d after use.

entry.para: The percent-encoded reference URI to join to the base_uri .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A string representing the percent-encoded join of the two URIs.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_is_writable ()
refsect2.para: Check if it is safe to write to this GstUri.
Check if the refcount of uri is exactly 1, meaning that no other reference exists to the GstUri and that the GstUri is therefore writable.
Modification of a GstUri should only be done after verifying that it is writable.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if it is safe to write to the object.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_make_writable ()
refsect2.para: Make the GstUri writable.

Checks if uri is writable, and if so the original object is returned. If not, then a writable copy is made and returned. This gives away the reference to uri and returns a reference to the new GstUri. If uri is NULL then NULL is returned.

entry.para: The GstUri object to make writable.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A writable version of uri .

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_to_string ()
refsect2.para: Convert the URI to a string.
Returns the URI as held in this object as a gchar* nul-terminated string. The caller should g_free() the string once they are finished with it. The string is put together as described in RFC 3986.

entry.para: This GstUri to convert to a string.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The string version of the URI.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_ref ()
refsect2.para: Add a reference to this GstUri object. See gst_mini_object_ref() for further info.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: This object with the reference count incremented.

refsect2.title: gst_uri_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrement the reference count to this GstUri object.
If the reference count drops to 0 then finalize this object.
See gst_mini_object_unref() for further info.

refsect2.title: gst_uri_is_normalized ()
refsect2.para: Tests the uri to see if it is normalized. A NULL uri is considered to be normalized.

entry.para: The GstUri to test to see if it is normalized.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the URI is normalized or is NULL.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_normalize ()
refsect2.para: Normalization will remove extra path segments ("." and "..") from the URI. It will also convert the scheme and host name to lower case and any percent-encoded values to uppercase.
The GstUri object must be writable. Check with gst_uri_is_writable() or use gst_uri_make_writable() first.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the URI was modified.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_get_scheme ()
refsect2.para: Get the scheme name from the URI or NULL if it doesn't exist. If uri is NULL then returns NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The scheme from the GstUri object or NULL.

refsect2.title: gst_uri_set_scheme ()
refsect2.para: Set or unset the scheme for the URI.

entry.para: The new scheme to set or NULL to unset the scheme.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the scheme was set/unset successfully.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_get_userinfo ()
refsect2.para: Get the userinfo (usually in the form "username:password") from the URI or NULL if it doesn't exist. If uri is NULL then returns NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The userinfo from the GstUri object or NULL.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_set_userinfo ()
refsect2.para: Set or unset the user information for the URI.

entry.para: The new user-information string to set or NULL to unset.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the user information was set/unset successfully.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_get_host ()
refsect2.para: Get the host name from the URI or NULL if it doesn't exist. If uri is NULL then returns NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The host name from the GstUri object or NULL.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_set_host ()
refsect2.para: Set or unset the host for the URI.

entry.para: The new host string to set or NULL to unset.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the host was set/unset successfully.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_get_port ()
refsect2.para: Get the port number from the URI or GST_URI_NO_PORT if it doesn't exist. If uri is NULL then returns GST_URI_NO_PORT.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The port number from the GstUri object or GST_URI_NO_PORT.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_set_port ()
refsect2.para: Set or unset the port number for the URI.

entry.para: The new port number to set or GST_URI_NO_PORT to unset.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the port number was set/unset successfully.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_get_path ()
refsect2.para: Extract the path string from the URI object.

entry.para: The GstUri to get the path from.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The path from the URI. Once finished with the string should be g_free()'d.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_set_path ()
refsect2.para: Sets or unsets the path in the URI.

entry.para: The new path to set with path segments separated by '/', or use NULL to unset the path.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the path was set successfully.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_get_path_string ()
refsect2.para: Extract the path string from the URI object as a percent encoded URI path.

entry.para: The GstUri to get the path from.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The path from the URI. Once finished with the string should be g_free()'d.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_set_path_string ()
refsect2.para: Sets or unsets the path in the URI.

entry.para: The new percent encoded path to set with path segments separated by '/', or use NULL to unset the path.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the path was set successfully.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_get_path_segments ()
refsect2.para: Get a list of path segments from the URI.

entry.para: The GstUri to get the path from.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A GList of path segment strings or NULL if no path segments are available. Free the list when no longer needed with g_list_free_full(list, g_free).

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_set_path_segments ()
refsect2.para: Replace the path segments list in the URI.

entry.para: The new path list to set.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the path segments were set successfully.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_append_path ()
refsect2.para: Append a path onto the end of the path in the URI. The path is not normalized, call gst_uri_normalize() to normalize the path.

entry.para: Relative path to append to the end of the current path.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the path was appended successfully.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_append_path_segment ()
refsect2.para: Append a single path segment onto the end of the URI path.

entry.para: The path segment string to append to the URI path.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the path was appended successfully.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_get_query_string ()
refsect2.para: Get a percent encoded URI query string from the uri .

entry.para: The GstUri to get the query string from.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A percent encoded query string. Use g_free() when no longer needed.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_set_query_string ()
refsect2.para: Sets or unsets the query table in the URI.

entry.para: The new percent encoded query string to use to populate the query table, or use NULL to unset the query table.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the query table was set successfully.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_get_query_table ()
refsect2.para: Get the query table from the URI. Keys and values in the table are freed with g_free when they are deleted. A value may be NULL to indicate that the key should appear in the query string in the URI, but does not have a value. Free the returned GHashTable with g_hash_table_unref() when it is no longer required. Modifying this hash table will modify the query in the URI.

entry.para: The GstUri to get the query table from.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The query hash table from the URI.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_set_query_table ()
refsect2.para:
Set the query table to use in the URI. The old table is unreferenced and a reference to the new one is used instead. A value if NULL for query_table
will remove the query string from the URI.

entry.para: The new query table to use.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the new table was sucessfully used for the query table.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_get_query_value ()
refsect2.para: Get the value associated with the query_key key. Will return NULL if the key has no value or if the key does not exist in the URI query table. Because NULL is returned for both missing keys and keys with no value, you should use gst_uri_query_has_key() to determine if a key is present in the URI query.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The value for the given key, or NULL if not found.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_set_query_value ()
refsect2.para: This inserts or replaces a key in the query table. A query_value of NULL indicates that the key has no associated value, but will still be present in the query string.

entry.para: The key for the query entry.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the query table was sucessfully updated.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_remove_query_key ()
refsect2.para: Remove an entry from the query table by key.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the key existed in the table and was removed.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_query_has_key ()
refsect2.para: Check if there is a query table entry for the query_key key.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if query_key exists in the URI query table.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_get_query_keys ()
refsect2.para: Get a list of the query keys from the URI.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A list of keys from the URI query. Free the list with g_list_free().

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_get_fragment ()
refsect2.para: Get the fragment name from the URI or NULL if it doesn't exist. If uri is NULL then returns NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The host name from the GstUri object or NULL.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_uri_set_fragment ()
refsect2.para: Sets the fragment string in the URI. Use a value of NULL in fragment to unset the fragment string.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the fragment was set/unset successfully.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: GstUri
refsect2.para: This is a private structure that holds the various parts of a parsed URI.
